etymologies: mid 19th century: from Hebrew ăp̄īqōmān, probably from Byzantine Greek epikōmion ‘a revel’

definitions: a piece broken off from a matzo during a Seder and put aside to be eaten at the end of the meal. It is traditionally hidden during the Seder to be searched for by the children present

examples.text: her little grandchildren will search the house looking for the afikoman

shortDefinitions: piece of matzo put aside to be eaten at end of Seder
